params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>B</mi>
      <mi>D</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>→<!-- → --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overrightarrow {BD}</annotation></semantics></math> is the ray that starts at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math> and extends infinitely in the direction of point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>A</mi>
      <mi>B</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo accent="false">¯<!-- ¯ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overline {AB}</annotation></semantics></math> represents the line segment that starts at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and ends at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>B</mi>
      <mi>A</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>←<!-- ← --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overleftarrow {BA}</annotation></semantics></math> represents the ray that starts at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and extends infinitely in the direction of point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>A</mi>
      <mi>D</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>↔<!-- ↔ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overleftrightarrow {AD}</annotation></semantics></math> represents a line that contains the points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math>. Notice the arrowheads on both ends of the line above <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mi class="MJX-tex-mathit" mathvariant="italic">A</mi>
    <mi class="MJX-tex-mathit" mathvariant="italic">D</mi>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\mathit{AD}</annotation></semantics></math>, which means that the line continues infinitely in both directions.
